resources.string: Hong Kong Guide
Sights
Hotels
Shops
Food
Duddell’s Chinese Restaurant
Duddell’s is a haven of sophistication offering inspiring art exhibitions, elegant design and Cantonese fine dining.
1 Duddell Street, Central, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
Kam’s Roast Goose
Kam’s Roast Goose proved its quality by gaining a Michelin star just four months after opening.
226 Hennessy Road, Wan Chai, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
Tim Ho Wan
Their signature is a crisp and fragrant baked bun with barbecue pork.
9-11 Fuk Wing Street, Sham Shui Po, Kowloon, Hong Kong
Écriture French Restaurant
Each dish effortlessly champions both regions, creating an inventive and at times surprising dining experience.
80 Queen Road Central, Central, Island, Hong Kong
Arcane European Restaurant
Arcane is an elegant dining spot has now earned its own Michelin star for its concise yet exquisite menu of modern European cuisine that incorporates fresh produce.
9-11 Fuk Wing Street, Sham Shui Po, Kowloon, Hong Kong
Caprice
Chef de cuisine Guillaume Galliot heads the kitchen and serves an inventive menu in an elegant dining room set within the Four Seasons.
9-11 Fuk Wing Street, Sham Shui Po, Kowloon, Hong Kong
Shitukatsu
Under the leadership of executive chef Yoshiharu Kakinuma, Shikon presents customers with meticulously crafted sushi, soup and desserts.
7/F Central, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
IBIS Hong Kong Central and Sheung Wan Hotel

It may have a long-winded title, but this ibis hotel is in a perfect location for exploring both Central and Sheung Wan. It’s walking distance to SoHo’s food and drink scene and the HK Macau Ferry Terminal.
No 28 Des Voeux Road West, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
AKVO Hotel
AKVO Hotel aims to be the perfect balance between comfort and luxury, which is noticeable in its 29 large guest rooms and suites.
No 28 Des Voeux Road West, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
Mo-Su 24h
Mojo Nomad Central
Mojo Nomad Central says it’s a new kind of boutique accommodation with design-led spaces and affordable luxury rooms.
286 Queen Road Central, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
Holiday Inn Express Hong Kong SoHo
Holiday Inn Express is located in an envious position. Guests can easily walk to SoHo, Lan Kwai Fong and Hollywood Road (known as Antiques Street).
No.83 Jervois Street, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
The Jervois
The Jervois is a National Properties’ boutique hotel in Sheung Wan.
89 Jervois Street, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
Butterfly on Waterfront
A reputable hotel chain in Hong Kong, Butterfly on Waterfront offers complimentary pocket Wi-Fi devices and smartphones with select rooms, and local ambassadors to help you plan your trip.
94 Connaught Road West, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
iClub Sheung Wan Hotel
The iclub Sheung Wan Hotel describes itself as a no-frills trendy hotel that targets self-sufficient and tech-savvy travellers with its optimal functionality.
138 Bonham Strand, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
Lab Concept

Beauty addicts should definitely hit up FACESSS, the beauty section at Lab Concept, an upscale multi-brand emporium in Admiralty. There are counters for over 50 beauty and skincare brands, including Dior Backstage Studio.
93 Queensway, Admiralty, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
Log On
Log On is a lifestyle store owned by retail chain Citysuper that specializes in upmarket imported goods, especially from Japan.
1 Matheson Street, Causeway Bay, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
SOGO

The ground and upper basement floors of this landmark Japanese shopping mall in the center of Causeway Bay are dedicated to premium beauty labels, featuring a host of mostly European and American upscale brands such as Chanel, Dior, Estee Lauder, Clarins, Bobbi Brown and more.
East Point Centre And East Point Centre (new Wing) Hennessy Road, Causeway Bay, Hong Kong Island
Lane Crawford
This luxury department store stocks the most coveted beauty, fragrance and skincare brands from around the world.
Causeway Bay, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
Brows a Go Go
The store carries Benefit’s complete line of premium brow products available for purchase, and lip and chin waxing services are also available.
22 Lyndhurst Terrace, Central, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
Flow Books
Founded in 1997 by a husband and wife, browsing the shelves at Flow Books is the quaintest of shopping experiences, with every nook and cranny crammed with overflowing volumes.
Sheung Wan, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
Etude House
This Korean cosmetics brand is extremely popular with Hong Kong’s younger, local crowd. They carry a range of products for eyes, lips, skin, nails and hair for a fresh and youthful look.
2 Matheson Street, Causeway Bay, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
Living Bookspace
Pop into this tiny bookshop in Yuen Long for an eclectic range of books at absurdly reasonable prices.
Shun Fung Building, 5 Fung Yau Street North, Yuen Long, New Territories, Hong Kong
8Five2
Launched in 1999, 8Five2 was one of the first local authentic skateboard and street fashion stores to open in Hong Kong.
1/F, 522 Jaffe Road, Causeway Bay, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
Ten Thousand Buddhas Monastery
This temple was founded in 1955 by Buddhist laymen Yuet Kai.By 1957, around 12,800 Buddha statues were made for this monastery.
Pai Tau, New Territories, Hong Kong
9:00–17:00. Mondays & Fridays closed.
Free
Miu Fat Buddhist Monastery

The first construction of the Miu Fat Buddhist Temple was in the 1950s. The building has a Buddhist Shrine, a community hall, a library, cultural welfare facilities and a kitchen serving vegetarian food.
Miu Fat Buddhist Monastery Complex Castle Peak Road (Lam Tei), Lam Tei, New Territories, Hong Kong
9:00–19:00. Tuesdays closed.
Free
Hong Kong Disneyland

This ever cheery American export is divided into seven themed “lands,” including Hong Kong exclusives such as Grizzly Gulch, which has an American Wild West theme, and Mystic Point, a mysterious rainforest with a haunted manor.
Lantau Island, New Territories, Hong Kong
Tang Contemporary Art
Hong Kong’s first “vertical art complex”, housed in a state-of-the-art glass tower designed specifically with galleries in mind.
80 Queen Road Central, Central, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
Edouard Malingue Gallery

Edouard Malingue Gallery showcases the works of both emerging and established creatives – from Hong Kong sound performance artist and composer Samson Young, to leading Korean abstract painter Cho Yong-ik.
Central, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
Hong Kong Correctional Services Museum
Encased within a two-story building that also houses ten galleries, all of which showcase the changes in the penal system over the last 160 years.
4 Tung Tau Wan Road, Stanley, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
Tian Tian Buddha
A trip to the majestic Tian Tian Buddha is a must for first time visitors to Lantau. The 112 ft-tall, 250 metric ton bronze sculpture rests on a podium that visitors must climb 268 steps to reach.
Ngong Ping Road, Lantau Island, New Territories, Hong Kong
8:00-18:45 Weekends closed
